summary: Build a cross-platform (Android/iOS) multiple-choice quiz app like Testbook called "My Test App" with Home, Quiz, and Result screens, using Airtable as the question data source and tracking score.
architectural_notes: Data source: Airtable table with columns Question, OptionA, OptionB, OptionC, OptionD, CorrectAnswer.
Navigation flow: Home -> Quiz (iterates questions) -> Result -> Home (restart).

existing_features.title: Create three screens (Home, Quiz, Result) for the app named "My Test App" and implement navigation between them: Home -> Quiz via a "Start Test" button, and Result -> Home via a "Restart Test" button.

Implement Airtable-backed question loading using the Airtable columns: Question, OptionA, OptionB, OptionC, OptionD, CorrectAnswer. Add configuration inputs for Airtable connection (Base ID, Table name or Table ID, and API token) without hardcoding secrets into the frontend bundle.
Provide a local fallback question set (static, bundled with the frontend) so the Quiz screen can still be used when Airtable is not configured or temporarily unavailable.

Build the Quiz screen to show one question at a time with 4 options (A, B, C, D). Selecting an option evaluates correctness against CorrectAnswer and increases score by +1 only when the selected option is correct.

Add a "Next" button on the Quiz screen that loads the next question. After the last question, automatically navigate to the Result screen and display the final score as "Your Score: X/Y" where Y is the total number of questions attempted in that run.

Apply the requested simple UI styling: white background, large readable text, and colorful buttons for the answer options; ensure the layout is mobile-friendly for Android/iOS-sized screens (responsive).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Home Screen with a "Start Test" button that navigates to the Quiz Screen
Create Quiz Screen that loads questions (one at a time) from Airtable (or local fallback) with 4 options and a "Next" button
Implement scoring logic: +1 for correct answer selection and compute total score over all questions
Create Result Screen displaying total score (e.g., "Your Score: 3/5") and a "Restart Test" button to return to Home
Integrate Airtable as a data source with columns: Question, OptionA, OptionB, OptionC, OptionD, CorrectAnswer
Apply simple UI design: white background, large readable text, colorful option buttons
